title: Design for today
creator_credit: Associated British-Pathe, Cammell Hudson, David Cammell, Lionel Hoare and Hugh Hudson
brief_description: An unintentionally hilarious promotional film becomes an involuntary instrument of social critism. Produced to promote the virtues of British design, the film chronicles a catalogue of constructed environmental features which all manifest a brutalising austerity. Park-O-Matics, Mini-Mokes and nuclear reactors become the indices of the sterile, proto-human coherance of consumer society. No narration; instead the film employs a great and swinging cocktail jazz score by UK session man, Johnny Scott.
